game_description: SAW meets ICO in this haunting and intimate title. - Experience a unique relationship with Katia, a girl who speaks a language you cannot understand (Stefanie Joosten, Quiet from Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain) and music by Hiroki Kikuta (SECRET OF MANA, SOULCALIBUR V) - 10+ hours of escape-adventure puzzle-solving, multiple endings. - Veteran team alumni from classic titles such as ICO, The Last Guardian, Shadow of the Colossus, Puppeteer etc. - Cross-Buy between Rift S/ Quest Escape a merciless mansion alongside a girl words cannot reach, in a tale that can only be experienced in VR. Director/Producer: Hiromichi Takahashi (Doko Demo Issyo, 1999),co-creator of Toro Co-Director: Tetsuya Watanabe (Puppeteer, The Last Guardian (in-game physics)) Lead Animator: Atsuko Fukuyama (ICO, Shadow of the Colossus) Lead Environment Artist: Michiko Kusaba (Gran Turismo 3:A-Spec, Gran Turismo 4) Sound Designer: Takuya Hanaoka (Monster Rancher, Super Robot Wars series)
Languages: English, Chinese (China), Chinese (Hong Kong), Chinese (Taiwan), Dutch, French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese (Brazil), Russian, Spanish (Spain)

review_4: So basically the game is about you being strapped to a wheel chair and you have to guide a little girl to solve puzzles and if you fail the girl dies and then you die, and there are many endings to this game. I tried to request a refund because I didn’t like the game but it was not approved and I don’t know why but it makes me mad because I don’t want the game anymore.
review_5: I rarely write bad reviews - if I don't like a game, other's might. That's ok. But this game is different: It's designed around watching a helpless little girl die brutally over and over again. Why does a game like that even exist?
